page.title: 07SHEEP FARMING - DOLPHINTON
page.content: Two types of sheep are kept in Dolphinton. Blackfaces on higher heather and rough grassland areas, and cross ewes on the "arable" grassland. Blackfaces are hardy and only need to be fed with hay and cereals in very bad weather. Crosses need to be fed all winter. Pure blackfacedlanbs, Suffolk for fattening and Blueheaded Leicesters for breeding are produced. Lambing percentages up to 150% are achieved. Cross ewes produce Suffolk cross lambs which can be killed at 5/6 months old wighing 100lbs (48kgs). Up to 6 ewes with 2 lambs each can be grazed on 1 acre of well managed grass. Lamb value Â£40. Problems are footrot, worms, pneumonia and abortion. 2 & 3 wheeled motorbykes are now used by most sheepfarmers, and there are no fulltime shepherds in Dolphinton.
